Xi and Putin's strategic friendship
subhead: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Beijing on Tuesday, on the eve of a major military parade, for what was at least his 45th meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping since both leaders have held power. Their close ties reflect the alliance Russia and China have forged against the West.
byline: By Benjamin Quénelle and Harold Thibault (Tianjin (China) special correspondent)

title: Belgium to recognize Palestinian state at UN General Assembly

For France's teachers, a back-to-school season marked by growing weariness
subhead: While they still say they love their profession, teachers expressed growing fatigue in the face of overcrowded classrooms, ever-dwindling resources, and nonstop reforms that leave their jobs uncertain. As a result, many are considering leaving the field altogether.
byline: By Eléa Pommiers and Sylvie Lecherbonnier

title: Block Everything is 'a movement structured almost exclusively around radical left sympathizers'
subhead: Bristielle conducted a study in the online groups of the Block Everything movement on September 10. He found that only 27% of respondents claimed to have been part of the Yellow Vest movement in 2019, he explained in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Louvre says 'game over' to its Nintendo 3DS visitor guide
subhead: Since 2012, visitors to the Paris museum have been able to use Nintendo's handheld console as a multimedia guide. The service ends on Monday, and the consoles will be returned to Nintendo.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'To succeed in the climate transition, we must redistribute wealth differently'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the French economist explains that protecting the planet from climate change cannot be achieved without reducing inequality.
byline: Interview by Nabil Wakim and Cécile Cazenave

title: Ukrainian forces turn to unmanned ground vehicles to counter drones
subhead: Specialized Ukrainian units using unmanned ground vehicles are emerging across all brigades. These machines already carry out most supply runs and evacuations on the front lines.

title: Evangelicalism in France continues to grow, driven by conversions
subhead: Members of evangelical churches, a branch of Protestantism, are increasing. These believers say they are drawn by a more informal liturgy and the emphasis on community.
byline: By Sarah Belouezzane and Benoît Vitkine
